description: Returns information about the association between an Amazon Lex bot and a messaging platform. This operation requires permissions for the lex:GetBotChannelAssociation action.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the association between the bot and the channel. The name is case sensitive.

parameters.name: botName
parameters.description: The name of the Amazon Lex bot.

parameters.name: botAlias
parameters.description: An alias pointing to the specific version of the Amazon Lex bot to which this association is being made.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the association between the bot and the channel.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A description of the association between the bot and the channel.

nested_items.name: botAlias
nested_items.description: An alias pointing to the specific version of the Amazon Lex bot to which this association is being made.

nested_items.name: botName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Lex bot.

nested_items.name: createdDate
nested_items.description: The date that the association between the bot and the channel was created.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of the messaging platform.

nested_items.name: botConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides information that the messaging platform needs to communicate with the Amazon Lex bot.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the bot channel.
CREATED - The channel has been created and is ready for use.
IN_PROGRESS - Channel creation is in progress.
FAILED - There was an error creating the channel. For information about the reason for the failure, see the failureReason field.

nested_items.name: failureReason
nested_items.description: If status is FAILED, Amazon Lex provides the reason that it failed to create the association.
